page.title: 10Farming (4)
page.content: Sproutes dairy farm (250 acres) has 160 milkers, bull beef and followers, 7 sows, 100 turkeys, geese, ducks, chickens, pheasants, a game licence for venison, and a small Farm Shop. The farmer is leaning towards organic farming. He is experimenting with growing certain herbs for hay in a l5-acre meadow (less productive than 3 cuts a year from Italian rye grass), and has cleared a pine plantation and planted oaks and deciduous woodland. His fields are too large, so he is planting mixed hedges of maple, holly, blackthorn, hawthorn and oaks. He and his wife are keen hunting people. (Several farmers are interested in the future use of lupins as a crop; these would not need spraying when in full flower, unlike rape. Also there are new varieties of rape being grown which should give fewer problems.)
